Create and Publish a Form in Marketing Cloud Growth

To capture user information, create a form and add it as a component on your landing page.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create and publish a form that uses data source fields	Modify All Data permission for the data source object, for the object fields on the form, and for the record type selected for the data source object

You must include at least one input component and one button on your form. To get started faster, create a signup form campaign.

From your marketing workspace, create or open a form.
Add or move components to create the layout that you want.
NOTE If you leave the API Name field blank when you create a new form, Salesforce creates an API name for you. After you save the form, you can’t edit the API name.
To include fields that aren’t related to a Salesforce object field, use one of these input components: Checkbox, Dropdown, Email, Phone Number, or Plain Text.
You must manually enter the picklist options for dropdown components. There’s no mapping to picklist values in Salesforce Setup. Information captured from these types of form fields is stored in the Unified Customer Profile.
To include fields that relate to Salesforce records, configure a data source.
You can add or change data sources at any time.
From the Fields tab, click Configure Data Source.
Give your data source a name.
Select the Salesforce Record data type.
Select an object and a record type.
Save the data source.
Drag the object fields onto the canvas.
Don’t change the API Name value of a field added from a data source. When visitors submit their information in these data source fields, the fields automatically map to record fields on the object that you selected, and a record of that type is created in Salesforce.
In the Form Submission section of the configuration panel, select what happens when a visitor submits the form.
Save the form.
Relate a flow to the form.
To autogenerate a preconfigured form submission flow, expand the Flow section and click Create a Flow.
To add an existing flow to the form, open Flow Builder and assign the form to a flow. Refresh the form to view the latest details.
Relate the flow to a campaign.
Save the form again.
When you’re ready to publish the form, click Publish.
NOTE Publishing a form activates the flow that’s associated with it.

To preview your form, save it, and then open the landing page that contains the form.

Data Sources for Forms in Marketing Cloud Growth
A data source is a representation of a set of data that you can access and configure. It functions as a bridge between a form and the Salesforce object data in your org. Adding a data source to your form helps you capture user information in a Salesforce record after a visitor submits the form.
Unpublish a Form in Marketing Cloud Growth
Remove your customers’ access to a form by unpublishing it. Unpublishing a form also deactivates the flow that’s related to it. After deactivation, the flow finishes running, but it doesn’t capture any more user data. If a form is unpublished while a user is entering their information, that user’s data isn’t captured when they click Submit.
Protect Forms with reCAPTCHA
Protect your marketing landing pages with forms from bots, fraudulent activities, spam, and abuse with Google reCAPTCHA. The Google reCAPTCHA v2 integration is available only for marketing landing pages with forms. It doesn’t apply to LWR sites or other sites built from templates.
Considerations and Limitations for Forms on Marketing Cloud Growth Landing Pages
When you’re working with a form on a landing page, keep these considerations and limitations in mind.
